notes: Summary: Vic Valence is hired to recover diamonds that were once the treasure of a 17th century pirate, then property of Miskito Indians in Nicaragua, and then stolen while being used to buy weapons for the Contras. 193.title: La Vengeance d'Happosaï
193.author: Rumiko Takahashi ; traduction, Wako Miyamoto, Olivier Prézeau ; adaptation graphique, Digibox ; lettrage, Fabrice Bras.

194.heading: Editions Glénat.
194.title: La Voie du Guerrier
194.author: Yves Swolfs ; Marc-Rénier ; couleurs, Marie-Noëlle Bastin.
notes: Western genre, about Indians of North America.

195.heading: Editions Glénat.
195.title: Zig, Puce et la Petite Princesse
195.author: par Alain Saint-Ogan.
notes: Comics pages collected from Dimanche Illustré.
Reprints the edition published in 1934 by Hachette, with the addition of pages left out of the original collection, and with the addition of two interviews with the artist.

198.heading: Editions Glénat--Catalogs.
198.title: Nouveautés.
198.author: [No author]
notes: Consists of "Nouveautés B.D." and "Nouveautés Beaux livres" printed back to back inverted.

199.heading: Editions Glénat--Miscellanea.
199.title: "A Propos d'Angoulême"
199.author: par Numa Sadoul
notes: Report on attending the first Angouléme festival, with a list of the awards: best French artist, Alexis ; best French writer, Christian Godard ; best French publisher, Glénat ; best foreign artist, Victor de la Fuente ; best foreign writer, Roy Thomas ; best foreign publisher, National Lampoon ; best new artist, Chiappori ; grand prize, André Franquin.

200.heading: Editions Glénat--Miscellanea.
200.title: Les Éditeurs de Bande Dessinée
200.author: entretiens avec Thierry Bellefroid.
notes: On cover: L'Association, Casterman, Cornélius, Dargaud, Delcourt, Dupuis, Frémok, Glénat, Les Humanoïdes Associës, Kana, Soleil.

201.heading: Editions Glénat--Miscellanea.
201.title: "Le Glénat Nouveau est Arrivé : Entretien avec Marcel Didier-Vrac"
201.author: propos recueillis par Thierry Groensteen
201.appears_in: p. 56-58 in Les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 67 (Jan./Feb. 1986).
notes: A new editor at Glénat talks about the company.

202.heading: Editions Glénat--Miscellanea.
202.title: "Glénat se penche sur son futur"
202.author: Jean-Pierre Fuéri
notes: Changes of personnel and contracts with some younger authors at Glénat.
